alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 04 at 7:47AM AKDT until June 05 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING UNTIL 1 AM AKDT SUNDAY FOR MIDDLE TANANA VALLEY... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect until 1 AM AKDT Sunday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...North of Fairbanks, including the White Mountains. * TIMING...10 am Today to 1 am Sunday. * WINDS...Northeast 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * TEMPERATURES...65 to 75. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires will be possible.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
